ProjectTitle: Exploring the reciprocal crosstalk between the vasculature in cancer to improve immunotherapy
InitialFeedbackHistory:
12/06/2023
Data: If you are going to reuse data which contains personal data please register this in the KU Leuvenâ€™s internal processing of personal data register, note that if you receive data that is already pseudonymous, it still falls under the GDPR and registration is needed. For more information see: https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/index, contact pret@kuleuven.be if you have any questions 
Documentation: please focus here on how you will document your data, where you store and secure your data is part of the next question. Which metadata standard will you use? When you receive existing data for reuse there may already be metadata according to a standard, and many instruments also generate metadata, sequencing comes often with MINSEQE and flow cytometry with MIFlowCyt, have a look at this when you are working with the data so you can add this in your future DMPs. For more information see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/documentation-metadata
Sharing: When looking for repositories please have a look at EBI (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/) and KU Leuven RDR (https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr), for more information see https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing
label: good with suggestions
